1.text: Mix 3-4 egg yolks with 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of water or milk.

2.text: Apply your egg wash to uncooked dough with a pastry brush.

3.text: Bake your dough according to instructions.

4.text: Boil milk and sugar together in a large pot.

5.text: Whisk 4 egg yolks, sugar, and cornstarch together.

6.text: Pour your cornstarch mixture into your milk and sugar mixture.

7.text: Stir the mixture for 3-5 minutes, or until it is thick.

8.text: Turn off your stove and add 1 ounce (0.028 kg) of butter.

9.text: Add 2 teaspoons (9.9 mL) of vanilla extract.

10.text: Transfer the custard mixture to a separate container and let your custard cool.

11.text: Mix together 1 egg yolk, white vinegar, and salt.

12.text: Add 1⁄4 cup (59 mL) of canola oil to the mixture gradually.

13.text: Whisk your mixture for about 8 minutes.

14.text: Chill your mayonnaise for about 1 hour.

15.text: Put your yolks in an airtight container to save for later.

16.text: Freeze your egg yolks with a simple syrup so they don’t crystalize.

17.text: Cure your egg yolks in salt.
